data.title: Ivy Tech Libraries at Ivy Tech Community College
data.meta_description: This is a useful guide in providing links to historical information. Local, state, government, and historical organizations are provided, along with databases for research purposes.
data.text:
Franco: A Personal and Political Biography by Stanley G. Payne; Jesús Palacios This book y biography of Franco is objective and balanced in its coverage, treating all three major aspects of his life: personal, military, and political. This book depicts his early life, explains his career and rise to prominence as an army officer who became Europe's youngest interwar brigadier general in 1926, and then discusses his role in the affairs of the troubled Second Spanish Republic (1931-36). The authors examine in detail how Franco became dictator and how his leadership led to victory in the Spanish Civil War that consolidated his regime.

Call Number: Ebscohost: ebook collection

ISBN: 9780299302108

From Guernica to Human Rights : Essays on the Spanish Civil War by Peter Carroll This book goes into detail about the Spanish Civil War, with information on Fascist aggression, foreign help form different countries, examines both sides of the conflict, and gives in much detail of the life's of survivors during the the civil war.

Call Number: Proquest: eBook Central

ISBN: 9781631011917

Spain in Arms : A Military History of the Spanish Civil War, 1936-1939 by E. R. Hooton This book examines eight campaigns waged between 1937 and 1939. Through detailed analysis, it demonstrates how many accounts of military operations during this conflict are based upon half-truths and propaganda. From the Madrid Front to the Catalonia Offensive, each campaigns is chronicled with special focus on the weapons and tactics used, as well as the moment-to-moment decisions of both Republican and Nationalist generals.

Call Number: Proquest: eBook Central

ISBN: 9781612006383

Blood, Oil and the Axis: The Allied Resistance Against a Fascist State in Iraq and the Levant, 1941 by John Broich This book discusses information about how the Allies fought the Axis in the Middle East and how they helped prevent the Axis powers from gaining access to oil, that was vital to Axis powers efforts to win WWII.

Call Number: Ebscohost: ebook collection

ISBN: 9781468313994

Rommel: a Reappraisal by Ian. F. W. Beckett This book is about Erwin Rommel, a famous German general who won many battles. Despite his loyalty to Hitler, he even worked on trying to remove Hitler as part of a plot. The book goes into detail on if Rommel deserved his status and the different views he had in the party..

Call Number: Ebscohost: ebook collection

ISBN: 9781781593592

The Battle of the Atlantic: How the Allies Won the War by Jonathan Dimbleby This book offers a detailed and immersive account of this massive and decisive campaign, placing it within the context of the war as a whole. The author delves into the politics on both sides of the Atlantic, revealing the role of Bletchley Park and the complex and dynamic relationship between America and England. He uses contemporary diaries and letters from leaders and sailors to chilling effect, evoking the lives and experiences of those who fought. This is the definitive account of the longest battle of World

Call Number: Proquest: eBook Central

ISBN: 9780190495855

The Battle of the Bulge: Hitler's Final Gamble by Patrick Delaforce This book goes into detail of the Battle of the Bulge, the battle itself, information on the Allies and Germans during the conflict, and what they did that changed the course of the war.

Call Number: Ebscohost: ebook collection

ISBN: 9781783463596

Churchill's Greatest Fear: The Battle of the Atlantic 3 September 1939 to 7 May 1945 by Richard Doherty This book covers all the major aspects of The Battle, balancing the initial advantages of Admiral Doenitz's U-Boat force, the introduction of the convoy system, the role of the opposing surface fleets and air forces, relative strengths and the all-important technical developments. Intelligence particularly the Bletchley Park intercepts played an increasingly important part in the final outcome. The author concludes that May 1943 was the moment when the Allies seized the initiative and, despite desperate German efforts, never lost their advantage.

Call Number: Ebscohost: ebook collection

ISBN: 9781473834002

The Eastern Front Air War 1941 - 1945 by Anthony Tucker-Jones This selection of over 150 photographs provides a visual guide to the desperate air war fought over the Eastern Front between 1941 and 1945. this book gives in detail the German and Russian side of the war, and the reversal of fortune between them.

Call Number: Ebscohost: ebook collection

ISBN: 9781473861626

Escaping Hitler's Bunker: The Fate of the Third Reich's Leaders by Sjoerd J. de Boer This book gives information on the Third Reich and the bunkers they occupied with Hitler before the final hours, giving information on who these men were, where they ended up, who lived, and who died.

Call Number: Ebscohost: ebook collection

ISBN: 9781526792693

Great Battles of World War II: How the Allies Defeated the Axis Powers by Nigel Cawthorne; Michael Dudley The author has taken a fresh look at the crucial battles which decided the outcome of the Second World War, beginning with the evacuation of Dunkirk in 1940, a feat that boosted the morale of a nation during its darkest hour, and reaching a climactic end with the final bloody reckoning between the Red Army and the Third Reich amongst the ruins of Berlin.

Call Number: Ebscohost: ebook collection

ISBN: 9781784289560

Hitler Versus Stalin: the Eastern Front 1941 - 1942 by Nik Cornish This book discusses about information about the Eastern front comparing Hitler verse Stalin, how the Soviets fought back, and the turning point of the war in the Eastern front that favored the Soviets to defeat the Nazi's in the the Eastern front campaigns.

Call Number: Ebscohost: ebook collection

ISBN: 9781783463985

Normandy 1944 by Simon Forty This book gives information about Normandy in 1944 and the Battle for Caen. The book gives a graphic account and a fascinating insight into the opposing forces, the conditions, the terrain, the equipment and weaponry deployed - and it illustrates just how intense and protracted the fighting was on the ground.

Call Number: Ebscohost: ebook collection

ISBN: 9781526723758

Saving Lives in Auschwitz: The Prisoners' Hospital in Buna-Monowitz by Ewa K. Bacon This book gives information about a Doctor named Stefan Budziaszek who worked in Auschwitz. the book goes into detail about his time there, the conditions in the camps, the people in the camps, the situations between the imprisoned, and the horrific events that took place.

Call Number: Ebscohost: ebook collection

ISBN: 9781557537799

Tank Warfare on the Eastern Front 1943-1945: Red Steamroller by Robert Forczyk This incisive study offers fresh insight into how the two most powerful mechanized armies of the Second World War developed their tank tactics and weaponry during this period of growing Soviet dominance. He uses German, Russian and English sources to provide the first comprehensive overview and analysis of armored warfare from the German and Soviet perspectives.

Call Number: Ebscohost: ebook collection

ISBN: 9781783462780

Bataan Survivor: A POW’s Account of Japanese Captivity in World War II by Frank A. Blazich (Editor); David L. Hardee This book is about Colonel David L. Hardee, his time in the Philippines, and as a prisoner. His memoir tells of how he survived the Bataan Death March, moved to prison camps, and his liberation from imprisonment all during the Pacific war.

Call Number: Ebscohost: ebook collection

ISBN: 9780826220820

The Battle of Midway: The Naval Institute Guide to the U.S. Navy's Greatest Victory by Thomas C. Hone (Editor) This Naval Institute guide includes some of the most vibrant and informed accounts by individuals who fought on both sides of the June 1942 battle. The anthology pulls together memoirs, articles, excerpts from other Naval Institute books, and relevant government documents to help readers understand what happened and explain why the battle was so significant to the naval service. The core of the book focuses on events leading up to the battle and the battle itself, with a separate section examining how others have interpreted the battle's often desperate engagements. This book tells how the American PT boats contributed to the victory, how the carrier planes formed up for their attacks, and what role radar played in the battle. From the enlisted man's perspective all the way to the admiral's, for both Americans and Japanese, readers see the U.S. Navy's greatest victory as the participants saw it.

Call Number: Ebscohost: ebook collection

ISBN: 9781612511269

China and Japan at War 1937 - 1945 by Philip Jowett Using a selection of almost 200 historic photographs, the author traces the course of the entire war between China and Japan war, between 1937-1945, from the Japanese invasion and the retreat of the Chinese armies and their refusal to surrender, to the involvement of the Americans and the eventual Japanese defeat in 1945. His graphic account is an absorbing introduction this often-neglected theater of the Second World War. The images show the armies on all sides and the weaponry and equipment they used. But they also record the experience of the troops, Chinese and Japanese, and of the Chinese civilians who suffered terribly through eight years of war.

Call Number: Ebscohost: ebook collection

ISBN: 9781473827523

December 7 1941: The Day the Japanese Attacked Pearl Harbor by Gordon W. Prange; Donald M. Goldstein; Katherine V. Dillon This book is an account of the morning that brought America into World War II, . Built around eyewitness accounts, this book provides an unprecedented glimpse of how it felt to be at Pearl Harbor on the day that would live in infamy.

Call Number: Proquest: eBook Central

ISBN: 9781480489509

Fire from the Sky: Surviving the Kamikaze Threat by Robert C. Stem This book looks at the origins of the campaign, at its strategic goals, the organization of the Japanese special attack forces, and the culture that made suicide not just acceptable, but honorable. However, the books principal focus is on the experience of those in the Allied fleets on the receiving end of this peculiarly alien and unnerving weapon how they learnt to endure and eventually counter a threat whose potential was over-estimated, by both sides. In this respect, it has a very modern resonance.

Call Number: Ebscohost: ebook collection

ISBN: 9781473814219
